title: sokani
author: sokani
content: This is more of a tech information but why I brought it here it's because I feel this info would be valuable to our local board because of the country we find ourselves in, the ban on cryptocurrency and it's a better way to protect ourselves from law enforcement agencies.How I got to know about this feature?Actually I got to know about it from a friend. Sometime ago, we were having a conversation on yahoo boys and he told me how second space saved him from been arrested by EFCC. He said he went to phone village at Tetlow road in Owerri to format his laptop. Few minutes later, EFCC operatives stormed the area with their buses, bundled all of them and asked them to unlock their phones while they go through it. If they see something like crypto wallet or exchange app, they would ask you to enter the bus. When he saw what was happening he quickly logged into second space and when it got to his turn, they checked and nothing implicating was found on his phone and that's how they left him. What is second space?I know there are other cool stuffs like antifreeze apps that one could use to hide apps but this is completely different. Think of the second space as another screen on your phone. It's like having coins (apps) on your palm(first space) and you can easily turn the back of your palm(second space) to reveal another set of coins. Apps can be arranged according to your preference on either the first space or second space and you can log into either of the spaces using a password or fingerprint. The shared files between both spaces is not limited to only apps, other files can be shared as well. This cool feature is available mostly on android phones running on snapdragon such as Xaomi, Redmi etc. To know more about second space you can google it.
